bitfield.description: 0 = disconnected. others = connected to channel_ID = CHANID.

bitenum.description: 0 is an allowed value, signifying that the event is unconnected
A value of 0 specifies that the event is not connected
Consult your device datasheet as the actual allowed maximum may be less than 15.

bitfield.description: Clear the RESETSTKY bit in the STAT register

bitenum.description: Writing 0 has no effect
Clear reset sticky bit
Writing 0 has no effect
Assert reset

bitfield.description: This bit indicates, if the peripheral was reset, since this bit was cleared by RESETSTKYCLR in the RSTCTL register

bitenum.description: The peripheral has not been reset since this bit was last cleared by RESETSTKYCLR in the RSTCTL register
The peripheral was reset since the last bit clear

bitfield.description: Event line mode select for event corresponding to [IPSTANDARD.INT_EVENT][0]

bitenum.description: The interrupt or event line is disabled.
Event handled by software. Software must clear the associated RIS flag.
Event handled by hardware. The hardware (another module) clears automatically the associated RIS flag.

bitfield.description: Event line mode select for event corresponding to [IPSTANDARD.INT_EVENT][0]

bitenum.description: The interrupt or event line is disabled.
Event handled by software. Software must clear the associated RIS flag.
Event handled by hardware. The hardware (another module) clears automatically the associated RIS flag.

bitfield.description: Module identification contains a unique peripheral identification number. The assignments are maintained in a central database for all of the platform modules to ensure uniqueness.
This bit defines the DAC input data format.

bitenum.description: Straight binary
Twos complement

bitfield.description: This bit enables the DAC module.

bitenum.description: DAC is disabled
DAC is enabled

bitfield.description: These bits define the DAC output voltage resolution.

bitenum.description: 8-bits resolution
12-bit resolution

bitfield.description: AMP_EN - output amplifier enabled or disabled 0 : disabled 1 : enabled
This bit selects the DAC voltage reference source + input.

bitenum.description: Analog supply (VDDA) as VR+
VEREFP pin as VR+

bitfield.description: These bits select the DAC output on device pin.

bitenum.description: No connect. Both DAC output switches are open.
OUT0 output is selected

bitfield.description: This bit selects the DAC voltage reference source + input.

bitenum.description: VEREFN pin as VR-
Analog supply (VSSA) as VR-

bitfield.description:
AMPHIZ - amplifier output value
0 : amplifier output is high impedance 1 : amplifier output is pulled down to ground

bitenum.description: HiZ when disable
dacout pulldown when disable

bitfield.description: This bit enables the FIFO and the FIFO hardware control state machine.

bitenum.description: FIFO is disabled
FIFO is enabled

bitfield.description: These bits determine the FIFO threshold. In case of DMA based operation, DAC generates new DMA trigger when the number of empty locations in FIFO match the selected FIFO threshold level. In case of CPU based operation, the FIFO threshold bits are don't care and FIFO level is directly indicated through the respective bits in the RIS register.

bitenum.description: One fourth of the FIFO locations are empty
Half of the FIFO locations are empty
Three fourth of the FIFO locations are empty
Reserved value. Defaults to same effect as FIFOTH = 0 (One fourth of the FIFO locations are empty).

bitfield.description: These bits select the source for FIFO read trigger. When the selected FIFO read trigger is asserted, the data from FIFO (as indicated by read pointer) is moved into internal DAC data register.

bitenum.description: Sample time generator output
Hardware trigger-0 from event fabric
Hardware trigger-1 from event fabric
Reserved - unimplemented

bitfield.description: This bit enables the DMA trigger generation mechanism. When this bit is set along with FIFOEN, the DMA trigger is generated based on the empty FIFO locations qualified by FIFOTH settings. This bit needs to be cleared by SW to stop further DMA triggers

bitenum.description: DMA trigger generation mechanism is disabled
DMA trigger generation mechanism is enabled

bitfield.description: This bit enables the sample time generator.

bitenum.description: Sample time generator is disabled
Sample time generator is enabled

bitfield.description: These bits are used to configure the trigger rate from the sample time generator. The STIMCONFIG values 10 to 15 are reserved and default to same effect as value 0 (500SPS).

bitenum.description: Trigger rate is 500 sps (clock divide value is 4000)
Trigger rate is 1 ksps (clock divide value is 2000)
Trigger rate is 2 ksps (clock divide value is 1000)
Trigger rate is 4 ksps (clock divide value is 500)
Trigger rate is 8 ksps (clock divide value is 250)
Trigger rate is 16 ksps (clock divide value is 125)
Trigger rate is 100 ksps (clock divide value is 20)
Trigger rate is 200 ksps (clock divide value is 10)
Trigger rate is 500 ksps (clock divide value is 4)
Trigger rate is 1 Msps (clock divide value is 2)

bitfield.description: This bit when set initiates the DAC offset error calibration sequence and is automatically reset when the offset error calibration completes.

bitenum.description: Offset error calibration is not active
Initiate offset error calibration or offset error calibration is already in progress

bitfield.description: This bit is used to select between factory trim or self calibration trim.

bitenum.description: Factory Trim Calibration Values are used when calibration is enabled
Self Calibration Trim Values are used when calibration is enabled

bitfield.description: DAC offset error calibration data. The DAC offset error calibration data is represented in twos complement format providing a range of 64 to +63. This is read-only bit, reflecting the calibration data. Writing to this register will have no effect, it will not change the calibration value.
This is the data written for digital to analog conversion.
